panels.description: The number of active workers in Kafka Connect cluster.
panels.title: Total workers

panels.description: The total number of connectors.
panels.title: Total connectors

panels.description: The total number of connector tasks.
panels.title: Total tasks

panels.description: The total number of running connector tasks.
panels.title: Running tasks

panels.description: The total number of failed connector tasks.
panels.title: Failed tasks

panels.description: The total number of paused connector tasks.
panels.title: Paused tasks

panels.description: The total number of unassigned connector tasks.
panels.title: Unassigned tasks

panels.description: The total number of destroyed connector tasks.
panels.title: Destroyed tasks

panels.description: The current status of connectors and their tasks.
panels.title: Connector and task status

panels.description: The status of connectors over time.
panels.title: Connector status over time

panels.description: The status of connector tasks over time.
panels.title: Connector task status over time

panels.description: The time since last rebalance of Kafka Connect worker.
panels.title: Time since last rebalance [$worker]

panels.description: Information about Oracle system change numbers.
panels.title: SCNs

panels.description: Statistics of connector transaction buffers.
panels.title: Transaction buffers

panels.description: The time difference in milliseconds between when a change occurred in the transaction logs and when its added to the transaction buffer.
panels.title: Lag from database in transaction buffer

panels.description: The duration for processing the last LogMiner query batch results in milliseconds.
panels.title: Mining batch time

panels.description: The number of rows processed per second.
panels.title: Processed rows per second

panels.description: The number of entries fetched by the log mining query per database round-trip.
panels.title: Mining batch size

panels.description: The current mining session’s user/process global area (UGA/PGA) memory consumption in bytes.
panels.title: Mining session consumption

panels.description: Statistics of Debezium connectors.
panels.title: Connectors

panels.description: The status of Debezium connector snapshots.
panels.title: Snapshot status

panels.description: The current size of the poll queue.
panels.title: Source record poll queue size

panels.description: The current size of the poll queue in bytes.
panels.title: Source record poll queue size in bytes

panels.description: The number of milliseconds between the last change event’s timestamp and the connector processing it. The values will incoporate any differences between the clocks on the machines where the database server and the connector are running.
panels.title: Time behind source event

panels.description: The per-second number of source records produced/polled (before transformation) by connector task.
panels.title: Source records polled per second (before transformation)

panels.description: The per-second number of sink records read from Kafka for connector task. This is before transformations are applied.
panels.title: Sink records read per second (before transformation)

panels.description: The per-second number of source records output from the transformations and written to Kafka for connector task. This is after transformations are applied and excludes any records filtered out by the transformations.
panels.title: Source records written per second (after transformation)

panels.description: The per-second number of sink records output from the transformations and sent/put to connector task. This is after transformations are applied and excludes any records filtered out by the transformations.
panels.title: Sink records sent per second (after transformation)

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds taken by connector task to poll for a batch of source records.
panels.title: Source record poll time

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds taken by connector task to put a batch of sinks records.
panels.title: Sink record put time

panels.description: The average size of the batches processed by the connector task.
panels.title: Task batch size

panels.description: The number of topic partitions assigned to connector task.
panels.title: Topic partition assignment

panels.description: Statistics of connector producers for topics.
panels.title: Producers

panels.description: The number of records sent per second.
panels.title: Records sent per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes sent per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes sent per second

panels.description: The average time in milliseconds record batches spent in the send buffer.
panels.title: Producer record queue time

panels.description: Statistics of connector consumers for topics.
panels.title: Consumers

panels.description: The number of records consumed per second.
panels.title: Records consumed per second

panels.description: The number of records in bytes consumed per second.
panels.title: Records in bytes consumed per second

panels.description: The lag in terms of number of records by clients. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.
panels.title: Consumer lag

panels.description: The average processing latency of a source record in milliseconds, measured by comparing the source timestamp with the system time when it has been processed by the task.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_source_task_record_process_avg_latency_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Source record processing latency

panels.description: The average time of a source record in milliseconds when it waits in the poll queue.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_source_task_record_poll_queue_avg_time_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Source record poll queue time

panels.description: The average end-to-end time of a source record in milliseconds, measured by comparing the source timestamp with the system time when the record sent to Kafka broker has been acknowledged.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_source_task_record_end_to_end_avg_time_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Source record end-to-end time

panels.description: The average total delivery time of a source record in milliseconds, measured by comparing the processing timestamp with the system time when the record sent to Kafka broker has been acknowledged.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_source_task_record_total_delivery_avg_time_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Source record total delivery time

panels.description: The average end-to-end time of a sink record in milliseconds, measured by comparing the source timestamp with the system time when the record was written to the downstream system.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_sink_task_record_end_to_end_avg_time_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Sink record end-to-end time

panels.description: The average total delivery time of a sink record in milliseconds, measured by comparing the processing timestamp with the system time when the record was written to the downstream system.

targets.expr: max(data_transfer_sink_task_record_total_delivery_avg_time_ms{job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*", connector=~"$connector"}) by (connector, task, sourceType, sourceName)

panels.title: Sink record total delivery time

panels.description: The information about CPU usage.
panels.title: CPU usage [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM threads.
panels.title: Threads [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage.
panels.title: Heap memory usage [$worker]

panels.description: The number of garbage collections triggered per second.
panels.title: Garbage collections triggered per second [$worker]

panels.description: The information about JVM heap memory usage in percent (%).

targets.expr: 100 * jvm_memory_bytes_used{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*"} / jvm_memory_bytes_max{area="heap", job="$job", instance=~".*$worker.*"}

panels.title: Heap memory usage in percent [$worker]

panels.description: The time in seconds spent in garbage collection.
panels.title: Time spent in garbage collection [$worker]
